text.p: Mohandes Bank said on Tuesday that its shareholders had agreed to increase the authorised capital of the bank to 300 million pounds ($88.4 million) from 100 million pounds.

The shareholders, at an extraordinary general assembly on Saturday, gave the board a mandate to raise new capital in instalments by issuing new shares, giving priority to existing shareholders, it said.
The bank said it would announce details of the first share issue soon, after obtaining the necessary approvals.
The general assembly also agreed to let shareholders convert bank shares denominated in dollars into Egyptian pound shares, it added.
Mohandes Bank has a paid-in capital of 100 million pounds, some in dollars and some in pounds.
